message: Hello Bob, I have a great product that I think you'll really like. I'm willing to offer it to you for $120.
I'm interested in the product, but I think it's a bit pricey. I'm willing to pay $90 for it.
I understand you think the product is pricey, but I have to make a living. I'm willing to meet you halfway. I'm now offering the product to you for $110.
I appreciate your willingness to meet me halfway, but I'm still a bit above my budget. I'm willing to pay $95 for the product.
I'm starting to think you're getting a good deal, Bob. I'm willing to compromise further. I'm now offering the product to you for $105.
I'm getting close, but I still think I can do better. I'm willing to pay $102 for the product.
You're really pushing me to the limit, Bob. I'm willing to give you a slight discount, but I need to make a profit. I'm now offering the product to you for $108.
I'm still not comfortable with that price. I'm willing to pay $100 for the product, my final offer.
I've decided to accept your offer, Bob. I'll sell the product to you for $100.
